This package allows you to generate text-based ASCII art using a library of 
pre-defined letter files.  

This vignette demonstrates how to configure your character library, load letter 
files, convert strings to indices, generate ASCII art lines, write the output to
a file, and read specific lines from files. By the end, you will be able to turn
any string into a text-based visual representation.

---

```r
library(asciiConverter) 

# Configure using default letters
vars <- configure()

# Pull components
filenames <- vars[[1]]
directory <- vars[[2]]
offset <- vars[[3]]

cat("Files:", filenames, "\n")
cat("Directory:", directory, "\n")
cat("Offset:", offset, "\n")

char_library <- load_files(directory, filenames)

# View the first few lines of the first letter
head(char_library[[1]])

text <- "HELLO"
indexes <- string_convert(text)
print(indexes)

size <- 7 
make_lines(indexes, size, char_library)

output_file <- "hello_art.txt"
make_file(indexes, size, char_library, output_file)
cat("ASCII art written to", output_file, "\n")
cat(paste(readLines(output_file), collapse = "\n"))

sample_files <- paste0(directory, filenames[1:3])
first_lines <- read_first_lines(sample_files)
print(first_lines)
```
